Functions

Function(s) admin.get_column_type.
return the data type of the column. Beware: an exception is thrown when the column does not exist. The column type is returned as formatted by the Postgres function format_type. Output examples: smallint smallint[] integer bigint numeric(10,4) real double precision boolean character(1) character varying character varying(80) "char" text timestamp without time zone example: select admin.get_column_type('oms','OrganizationDO','id');

FUNCTION admin.get_column_type ( p_shema character varying, p_table character varying, p_column character varying ) RETURNS character varying LANGUAGE 'plpgsql' volatile;
